channel.title: Portforwarding
channel.description:
First of all, portforwarding is merely a step to allow people connecting to your computer, but in this case it's for connecting to your server. We will first start off by opening your command prompt or 'cmd' through your startup
im guessing "cmd" is run?? and when i type ipconfig in there is pop ups then disapears real fast what do i do?

item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

I agree, but technically it is help on getting the server to work.

item.title: Portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

So the reason Start > CMD > ipconfig won’t work is because something went wrong with your environment variables. (You are only supposed to change your USER Variables NOT SYSTEM)

Go back to your variables and under the SYSTEM Variables

Create a new Variable
Path

And put this inside it as the value

C:\windows\system32

Then try START > CMD > ipconfig
again

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @Huamph Huamph
item.description:
@Huamph wrote:

[quote=“Fox0wnage, post:9, topic:286735”]He still needs all his IP information. DNS, gateway etcc.[/quote]To get into the router it will mostly likely be 192.168.1.1 or 192.168.1.2

The port checker says forward the port you want to test in your router to this IP address: then it lists the ip he needs to forward too. He probably won’t need to do that all[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2009, 04:46:14 pm[/size][hr][quote=“99hpw0w, post:10, topic:286735”]yeah im so confused i mean i am on a administrator acc and what exactly would i type into google?[/quote]Try to enter your router. In the address bar type 192.168.1.1, leave the username blank, for the password put admin. Tell me if you got in.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @Huamph Huamph
item.description:
@Huamph wrote:

Another thing to do is go to www.portforward.com and click “Port Checker” and download it. It will tell you what ip to forward too, and when you are done it will check to see if it was successful.

Direct link: http://www.portforward.com/help/portcheck.htm

Read full topic

You’re on vista correct?

item.title: Portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

Go to
Start --> My Computer --> C: --> Windows --> system32 --> cmd.exe
and open that and type ipconfig

EDIT: Fixed, sheesh :rolleyes:

Read full topic

Start > run > type cmd > ipconfig
